result.execSummary:
The defendant Stevon D Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: DNA sample to be taken and DNA assessment to be paid. Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges including DNA by 04-12-17 or entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed. Cash bail applied.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stevon D Thompson

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentences defendant to serve 80 days in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 80 (eighty) days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered DNA sample to be taken and DNA assessment to be paid. Court ordered defendant pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) by April 12, 2017 or entry of a civil judgment shall be imposed.
.
20 day appeal rights given, 

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

ADDRESS INFO for Stevon D Thompson
Current: 4945 N. 39th Street Apt.@2, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 04-12-2016)
Prior: 5175 North Teutonia Avenue Apt 1, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Defendant Stevon D Thompson in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

16RM017190  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-22-2016

Defendant Stevon D Thompson in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Defendant Stevon D Thompson in custody and not produced.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stevon D Thompson in court with attorney Zoe Everett.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Zoe Everett in court, defendant Stevon D Thompson not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 31.  Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Stevon D Thompson

Prior: 5175 North Teutonia Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Stevon D Thompson in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Stevon D Thompson in custody.    Student Intern Carl Knepel under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.   Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rifelj, Br. 31.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
